Version

This is version 2 of the file.

Purpose

Function class for the OFTL Lua interface.

Author

Daniel “q66” Kolesa quak.nosp@m.er66@gmai.nosp@m.l.com

License

This file is licensed under MIT.  See COPYING.txt for more information.

lua

namespace lua

Function

struct Function: Object

This represents a Lua function.  Example

lua::Function print = lua["print"];
print("hello world");

Inherits Object.

()

template<typename... T> void operator()(const T&... args) const

Calls the function with given arguments.  Returns nothing.  If you want to get return values, use call.

call

template<typename... T, typename... U> typename Call_Ret_Type<T...>::type call(
   const U&... args
) const

Calls the function with given arguments.  Returns either one value (if you pass one template argument) or a tuple of values (if you pass multiple ones).  Template arguments basically specify types of return values.

call

template<typename... T> void call(const T&... args) const

struct Object
This is an object, a container holding a reference to any Lua type.
